panelText.text: At Johnson Controls, we believe in vigorous competition, but we don’t use illegal or unethical means to gain advantages over our competitors.

Many countries have laws to protect companies and consumers from anti-competitive agreements and unfair competitive practices. These laws are generally referred to as competition laws (or antitrust laws in the U.S.).
As a large, global company, Johnson Controls must be aware of our often strong and sometimes dominant position in the marketplace.
We are committed to complying with fair competition laws.
